text: The 1913 Southwestern Moundbuilders football team represented Southwestern College in the 1913 college football season.http://www.cfbdatawarehouse.com/data/coaching/alltime_coach_game_by_game.php?coachid=6479&year;=1913 The team won the Kansas State Championship. Clapp fielded an African American player for his team. Kansas Normal School (now called Pittsburg State University officially launched a formal protest against the appearance of the player.New York Times "Protest Negro Football Player" November 21, 1913 In that same game, a player named Fred Hamilton was playing left halfback and was injured to the extent of having a broken neck and paralyzed arms.Reading Eagle "Telegrams" December 3, 1913 The game ended in a 6-6 tie.College Football Data Warehouse Fred H. Clapp 1913 Football Season ==References== Southwestern Category:Southwestern Moundbuilders football seasons Southwestern football
title: 1913 Southwestern Moundbuilders football team
